results.title: Fire over England
results.creator_credit: William K. Howard, Erich Pommer, Pendennis and London Film Productions
results.brief_description: Historical drama dealing with England’s struggle against the Spanish Armada. Performances by Vivien Leigh, Laurence Olivier, Flora Robson and an early performance by James Mason. Based on the novel by A.E.W. Mason.
results.creator_credit_for_label: William K. Howard, Erich Pommer, Pendennis and London Film Productions

results.title: Another Country
results.creator_credit: Marek Kanievska, Alan Marshall, Goldcrest and Castlezone
results.brief_description: Guy Bennett is nearing the end of his last year at a leading English boarding school. His best friend, Tommy Judd, is a Marxist, committed to Lenin’s brave new world. In a school permeated by homosexuality, affairs between the boys are accepted, provided discretion is practised. Bennett breaks this unwritten rule and the humiliating consequences establish within him a rejection of the system that excludes him. Scripted by Julian Mitchell from his own play.

results.title: The Big Sleep
results.creator_credit: Howard Hawks and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: Based on Raymond Chandler’s novel of the same name, “The Big Sleep” stars Humphrey Bogart as Philip Marlowe, the private eye who “dares to walk the mean streets alone”. Investigating a series of gambling debts he comes across plenty of murder, blackmail, kidnapping and violence. Lauren Bacall plays opposite Bogart and the screen magic between them in this film is legendary. The witty dialogue is scripted by William Faulkner. A consummate Hollywood film noir.

results.title: Anne of Green Gables: The Sequel (Captioned)
results.brief_description: Multi-award winning “Anne of Green Gables: the Sequel” continues the charming story of Anne Shirley, now an attractive and high spirited 18 year old teacher at Avonlea, whose life is brimming with romantic dreams, comic mishaps and adventure. Based on three books by Lucy Maud Montgomery: “Anne of Avonlea”, “Anne of the Island”, and “Anne of Windy Poplars”.

results.title: Mad Max (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: George Miller, Byron Kennedy, Kennedy Miller Productions and Mad Max Films
results.brief_description: Mad Max marked the debut of Australian director George Miller and his first collaboration with Mel Gibson. Part science fiction, part road movie, “Mad Max” is a futuristic vision of a post-apocalyptic Australia where ordered society is fast disintegrating into violent chaos. In this anarchic setting, rogue gangs menacingly roam the land in search of petrol (a vital and increasingly scarce resource), spoils of looting and bloodthirsty fun. Mel Gibson stars as Max Rockatansky, a good cop made mad by the death of his wife and child and the hands of a gang of feral bikies. The film follows Max as he embarks on a personal vendetta to avenge the death of his family, armed with anger, a gun and his car - “the last of the V-8 interceptors”. “Mad Max” has a much-imitated visual and thematic style - gang members are clad in filthy rags with maimed bodies; the landscape is bleak and featureless; camps are transitory pit-stops between war zones; and machines rule their owners. “Mad Max”, with its ordinary hero and car culture narrative, fits neatly into the zeitgeist of 1970s filmmaking. A nihilistic road movie, fuelled by male angst, “Mad Max” is a thrilling, truly original film that remains a highlight of Australian film history.

results.title: Swann in Love = Un Amour de Swann
results.creator_credit: Volker Schlondorff, Nicole Stephane, Eberhard Junkersdorf, Margaret Menegoz, Les Films du Losange, Bioskop Film and Gaumont-British Instructional
results.brief_description: Based on one of Marcel Proust’s stories from “Remembrance of things past”, the film tells the story of Charles Swann’s obsessively jealous passion for the socially unsuitable Odette de Crecy. Stars Jeremy Irons, Alain Delon and Ornella Muti.

results.title: La Bamba (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Luis Valdez, Taylor Hackford, New Visions Pictures and Columbia
results.brief_description: Musical biography of Ritchie Valens, a poor Mexican-American who became a rock’n’roll sensation at age 17 in the 1950’s. Lou Diamond Phillips portrays Valens whose musical career ended when he was killed in the plane crash that also claimed the life of Buddy Holly. The music of Valens is performed by Los Lobos on the soundtrack.

results.title: Oliver (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Carol Reed, John Wolf, Romulus Films, Warwick and Columbia
results.brief_description: Perhaps the best loved of all family pictures, “Oliver” is a joyous and entertaining version of Dickens’ “Oliver Twist”. Mark Lester plays Oliver, the foundling who escapes the indignities of the workhouse to find success and happiness in the London underworld. Oliver’s new friends include the Artful Dodger and Fagin who teach him to “pick a pocket”. Star roles are played by Harry Secombe, Oliver Reed and Shani Wallis.

results.title: The Karate Kid (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: John G. Avildsen, Jerry Weintraub and Columbia Pictures
results.brief_description: Daniel, a fatherless teenager, arrives in Los Angeles from the East Coast and faces the difficult task of making new friends. He becomes the object of bullying by a menacing gang of karate students, the Cobras, when he strikes up a relationship with the leader’s ex-girlfriend, Ali. Daniel’s handyman, Miyagi, a master of martial arts, teaches him karate and that fighting is always a last answer to a problem. Daniel learns that karate is a mastery over the self, mind and body, and develops physical skills as well as faith and self confidence.

results.title: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles: the Movie (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Steve Barron, David Chan, Simon Fields, Kim Dawson, Limelight Entertainment and Golden Harvest
results.brief_description: The four baby turtles who strayed into radioactive waste and mutated to become human sized talking reptilians with a hearty appetite for pizzas and rock music were raised by the Japanese ninja master water rat Splinter in the sewers of New York City. Now the dreaded Shredder is recruiting teenagers to commit a wave of robberies which has the city in panic. So it’s up to the four fearless turtles to save the day with a little help from feisty TV reporter April. Cowabunga! Based on the comic-book creation of Kevin Eastman and Peter Laird.
